titleStmt.title: W. H. Sandford to Smith Wingate
CWG5099

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky June 8th/64
Smith Wingate Esqr
Dear Sir

In answer to your letter requesting a statement from me as to my recollection of the agreement between you & R Hutchinson late atto for the Comth. I state from the best of my recollection that, it was agreed between you & him that W B. Vallandingham should take his case (a similar one to yours) to the Court of Appeals, and that your case would abide the decision in Vallandinghams case. That case was taken to the Court of Appeals & I understand reversed. And no action was had in your case from Nov 1853 until this winter, when a capias pro fine was issued at the instance of T S Haydon agent for the Auditor.
